meanings.definition: An image that persists after the stimulus that created it has ceased.
meanings.sent1: After looking at the bright light, I saw colorful afterimages when I closed my eyes.
meanings.sent2: The afterimages of the fireworks danced in her vision long after the show ended.
meanings.sent3: The afterimages of the movie characters seemed to wave goodbye as the screen went dark.
meanings.sent4: The afterimages of the sunset painted the sky with vibrant hues even after the sun had disappeared.
meanings.sent5: The afterimages of the lightning strike were etched in his memory, flashing before his eyes.

meanings.definition: A visual sensation that remains after the stimulus has been removed.
meanings.sent1: She blinked repeatedly to clear the afterimages of the camera flash from her eyes.
meanings.sent2: The afterimages of the bright light lingered, making it hard to see clearly for a few moments.
meanings.sent3: The afterimages of the neon sign seemed to play hide-and-seek with her vision.
meanings.sent4: The afterimages of the fireworks lit up the night sky like fleeting ghosts.
meanings.sent5: The afterimages of the lightning strike left a trail of brightness in her vision.
